content:
Greg Price said:

Or the API key could move there (from "Your Account"), and make the name like "Privacy & Security".

Splitting the settings organization discussion into a separate thread.

Alex Dehnert said:

Twitter has "Settings and privacy" and within that "Privacy and safety". Discord also does "Privacy and safety". Checking half a dozen or so other sites didn't find anybody else that put anything even that similar together, so who knows.

Google has "Privacy and security" in their settings, which is probably why it sounds normal/familiar to me too.
Should we go with "Privacy and security" too?
Sure, that seems like how others are going for it. Maybe because "Privacy" is more of a consumer word than "Security".
We probably will need to move the "Change password" widget there as well.

So I think we're effectively splitting "Your account" into two pages:

  • "Your profile", with name, avatar, and custom profile fields, would be the first page with a new label.
  • "Privacy and security", with your role, email address, password, and API key, and also this bundle and other things with time?
Which side does "Deactivate account" go on?
@Sahil Batra this might be a good mini-project for you to take since you just did another settings reorganization.
(But we probably want to spec out the subsections/labels and finalize these decisions before one can really do it)
That split sounds good. Could simplify the name to just "Profile", too.

Tim Abbott said:

Which side does "Deactivate account" go on?

Neither side is a perfect fit. I think I'd lean to "Profile", partly because that helps make it evident that there is a way to deactivate your account.

(Not that many people may actually do it, but I think many people may find it reassuring that they have the option.)

I took a quick look at GitHub for comparison, and their solution is... it's on a third page entirely:
image.png

Changing password is on "Account security", along with 2FA and logged-in sessions; "Profile" is what it says; "Delete account" is on "Account", along with "Change username", "Export account data", and "Successor settings" (TIL).

Mm, my vague recollection is that when looking at Github settings, I'm often having to guess where the thing I'm looking of is going to be, because there are too many similar options. So I'd be inclined not to create too many groupings.
I suppose "Profile" would stay as the top section? Where should "Privacy and security" go? Maybe just above "Your bots"?
I'd put "Privacy and security" just below "Profile"; the place to change your password should be prominent, not buried halfway down the page.
Ah, yeah, good point.

Alya Abbott said:

Mm, my vague recollection is that when looking at Github settings, I'm often having to guess where the thing I'm looking of is going to be, because there are too many similar options. So I'd be inclined not to create too many groupings.

Yeah, agreed -- that is probably not an aspect to follow GitHub on :smile:
I transcribed the conclusions here to #18848. @Sahil Batra FYI

I have started working on this, the profile page as per current input elements and the issue looks like below - Screenshot-from-2021-06-18-19-29-13.png

Some points that I observed -

  1. We should make the input field for name similar to others means a simple text box and we can disable it if changing name is not allowed. It looks odd with only one input being different.
  2. Deactivate button should also be either at the end or in the Security section.
  3. I have kept the profile picture in the right side for now, as keeping it in left side was not looking good.
  4. Have removed section headings as mentioned in the issue. If we want to keep the deactivate button after name then we should have it as a different section with heading. And otherwise also, we can have a single heading Your Profile at the top.
  5. Do we want only 'Profile written in the left sidebar or Your profile`.

I would love to have any other suggestions and would be happy to share the screenshots here after making changes according to suggestions.
Also, need to change the icon of Privacy and Security in the left sidebar.

I agree with all of those.

I'd put the big red "Deactivate" button at the end. In general GitHub settings pages seem to always have the red "destructive" actions at the end of the page, and that seems sensible.
For the icon, a "lock" icon would be good.
I'd lean toward "Privacy & Security", with an ampersand instead of "and".
I'd also lean toward "Profile" vs. "Your Profile".
Everything above (from both Sahil's and Greg's comments) sounds good to me!

Greg Price said:

I'd put the big red "Deactivate" button at the end. In general GitHub settings pages seem to always have the red "destructive" actions at the end of the page, and that seems sensible.

I don't like this idea -- because "custom profile fields" have highly variable length, it's easy for the "Deactivate" button to get hidden at the bottom if an organization configures a lot of these.
We could consider putting it below the avatar. Or think about whether it should go on a different screen.

Have done some more changes and also sharing the screenshot of privacy & security page. Screenshot-from-2021-06-20-15-28-51.png Screenshot-from-2021-06-20-15-28-42.png

We also need to think about how to handle saving after editing the name. Currently for custom profile fields, we just save the field after clicking outside the input for normal text fields. We would want to have same mecanism of saving for custom profile fields and user name. One option is to keep the current behavior of custom profile fields for name also and other option is to use the save/discard widget that we use in organization settings.
@Sahil Batra yeah, I think we should make "Full name" use the same mechanism as the custom profile fields, since it's no longer UI/visually distinct from them.
(Though we should remember that changing one's name can be disabled in organization settings, so we should be sure to test that)

What do we think about the deactivate button?
If we keep it in right, then do we need a separate heading as we have Profile picture heading for now. And also we need to decide a place for showing error message in that case.
Or do we want to keep it in Privacy and Security section.
I think I'd be more likely to look for it on the main "Profile" page... What if we spaced it lower down on the right hand side, where it wouldn't look connected to the avatar?

I kinda think that having it be on "Privacy and security" would make it easier to find than anywhere we put it on the "Profile" page.

We could also consider a title like "Account and privacy" to make it more obvious -- "Account" is where I'd look for "change email" and "deactivate account" more so than "security".
That's fair -- do we really have any security settings?
Things like 2-factor authentication will go on there when we add it, and your API key is definitely in that category, but "Account" is also a natural place for account security settings like that.
The current implementation looks like this - Screenshot-from-2021-06-25-16-26-58.png Screenshot-from-2021-06-25-16-26-53.png

One problem in above is when we would have no custom profile fields in the organization, the Profile page will look empty with only name field
Screenshot-from-2021-06-25-16-27-18.png

Tim has also suggested having a modal for Custom profile fields in #18417 which would also result in a lot of empty space with probably a button for opening the modal being added.
Hmm, with this change, I think having the custom profile fields right there might be better than the modal idea.
When there are a lot of custom fields, perhaps moving the preview button to the right (under the avatar) would look better?

When there are a lot of custom fields, perhaps moving the preview button to the right (under the avatar) would look better?

Yes we can do that. But we woul need to decide a threshold for number of fields.

Hmm, with this change, I think having the custom profile fields right there might be better than the modal idea.

Then also in the case where there are no custom profile fields, it will look odd IMO to show just name and preview profile button on that page.
On the tabs---why "Profile" instead of "Your Profile"? There's "Your bots." I don't have a strong preference either way, just wondering if there's any rationale.

Jore said:

On the tabs---why "Profile" instead of "Your Profile"? There's "Your bots." I don't have a strong preference either way, just wondering if there's any rationale.

There isn't any particular reason for it.
Would "Your profile" work better? It's currently "Your account" at the moment, which is good.

I think the motivation for "Profile" is just that it should be clear anyway that it's your profile, so the idea is to remove unnecessary words. Do you think "Profile" is potenitally ambiguous/confusing?

Sahil Batra said:

Hmm, with this change, I think having the custom profile fields right there might be better than the modal idea.

Then also in the case where there are no custom profile fields, it will look odd IMO to show just name and preview profile button on that page.

It doesn't really solve the problem, but I suppose for admins, we could point out that the org hasn't set any custom fields and add a link to that part of the org menus, to advertise the feature.
Yeah this is a good idea, will prototype this.

Alya Abbott said:

I think the motivation for "Profile" is just that it should be clear anyway that it's your profile, so the idea is to remove unnecessary words. Do you think "Profile" is potenitally ambiguous/confusing?

Maybe a little, esp as there is "Your bots"... ? If either or, it' just the inconsistency that seems slightly odd?

We could with equal accuracy say "Your alert words", "Your display settings", etc. But I think it's better without the "Your" in all those cases too.

"Your bots" could perhaps also be just "Bots". But perhaps with that one there's a bit more potential for confusion, in that "bots" might sound like a thing that wouldn't be yours in the first place, and rather would belong to the organization.
My vote is to keep the “your” in all these places.
Do you mean adding it in those other places? We currently say "Alert words", "Display settings", etc.

Sahil Batra said:

Yeah this is a good idea, will prototype this.

Does simple text like this look fine or do we need some styling like text being some shade of gray. And also the position of text wrt to Preview Profile button.
Screenshot-from-2021-06-29-12-36-00.png
Looks great!

And re the "Your Profile" etc discussion, I agree with Steve. I think if bots needs "Your bots" then profile should be "Your profile" the rest can stay as is. Just like how it used to read "Your account", "Your bots"

Screenshot-from-2021-06-29-17-17-35.png

Here's my two cents.
I agree with Greg that the "Your" prefix in all those cases is unnecessary (including bots). Particularly, because the user is already in the "Settings" tab and not the "Organization setting" so confusing those settings with the organization seems highly unlikely. An even better alternative might be to change the wording of the tab to "Personal | Organisation", and similarly in the gear menu i.e. Settings -> Personal settings? Something like this:
settings-overlay.png gear-menu.png
That's a much better solution, yes.
I like it! Filed #19051. @Zeeshan Equbal @Sahil Batra FYI
Yeah, I really like that last idea.

Tim suggested adding timezone and date joined fields with the name to make the page look decent when there are no custom profle fields here. I prototyped this Screenshot-from-2021-06-30-17-55-58.png Screenshot-from-2021-06-30-17-57-24.png

Few points-

  • The headings in the screenshot needs to be changed. I just wanted to share how it looks.
  • Changed the Full name field to be modal again because the Date Joined field needs to have the label and the value in the same line. So, it makes sense to make a different section with all the fields having label and value on same line. Though we can still keep the label and value inline and remove the modal and keep it as a simple input field as I did before.
  • If we are having different section for these 3 fields, we can use save discard widget also for saving or keep it same as we do for custom profile fields where we just save after changing the input.

I think Full Name being a normal input was nice; I'd be tempted to just figure out a style for displaying a fixed value in our settings design pattern. E.g. on theory is that we should make the labels have strong styling, and then we can have:

<strong>Date joined</strong>
June 12, 2015

<strong>User ID</strong>
12345 [copy button]

not look terrible. (The second item from the proposal in #general > user/stream IDs).

And then we can probably keep the "Profile" heading for everything, and not visually distinguish custom profile fields from the normal ones.

Thoughts about this?
Screenshot-from-2021-06-30-23-22-32.png
Seems pretty clean. Is there anything specific we should be looking at?
Not really, just wanted to share the look of what Tim suggested above.
I definitely prefer the in-place editing over the modals.

I think my bold idea doesn't work out because it's going to force us to use bold everywhere for consistency. My new proposal is that we just do:

"Joined on {date}"

on a single line in the normal label font. I think that'll end up looking OK alongside these other elements and avoid pressure to do design changes.

@Tim Abbott what about this?
Screenshot-from-2021-07-01-00-39-54.png
@Sahil Batra hmm, looking at that, I kinda feel like "Joined: {date}" might look better. And actually I think that internationalize better too. Try that out?
Screenshot-from-2021-07-01-00-51-08.png

Without custom profile fields -

Screenshot-from-2021-07-01-01-10-18.png
Looks good to me!
Updated the PR #19038 with the above design.
And merged after a few more tweaks! We should remember to move the presence privacy setting to the new "Account and privacy" screen, since right now it's a misleading label.

Great! Just a ping on Zeeshan's good point too from the other day:

Zeeshan Equbal said:

Here's my two cents.
I agree with Greg that the "Your" prefix in all those cases is unnecessary (including bots). Particularly, because the user is already in the "Settings" tab and not the "Organization setting" so confusing those settings with the organization seems highly unlikely. An even better alternative might be to change the wording of the tab to "Personal | Organisation", and similarly in the gear menu i.e. Settings -> Personal settings? Something like this:
settings-overlay.png gear-menu.png
Would Personal | Organisation still be a go?
Yes, would be done today itself.
Nice one. :smile:

Here is the screenshot for presence setting in Account and privacy page.
Screenshot-from-2021-07-01-19-29-17.png
Screenshot-from-2021-07-01-19-30-59.png

I think having Privacy section just after Account is better.

Or we can move this setting to Account section itself but I think having separate section even with one setting only is better.
Also do we want to have a Presence subsection inside Privacy section as of now as there is only one setting there. Maybe we can do so when we add more settings there in future.
I like the second screenshot. I don't think we need a Presence subsection until we add more settings.
Yeah, the second screenshot is what I'd had in mind as well.
Same preference for me too. Opened #19091.
OK, #19091 is merged, so we've completed this migration and I think are ready to add a setting for "Disable typing notifications", as was discussed above.
Perhaps "Display whether I'm typing messages to other users", default=true, with the variable being called send_typing_notifications?

And then we'd have "Display whether I've read messages to other users" for the read receipts feature, as send_read_receipts? That name feels substantially more awkward given the current model that read receipts would only be available on request, but maybe that doesn't matter.
Yes, those sound good to me. Perhaps I can start working towards adding those in a separate PR and update typing indicators and read receipts PRs once that is merged?

Should we also consider separating the typing notifications one into send_typing_notifications_in_streams and send_typing_notifications_in_pms? I'm not sure if anyone would prefer sharing typing data in one and not in the other but thought it's worth mentioning to know if there's someone who'd prefer having them separate.
Hmm, generally I'd favor a single setting, but I actually could imagine myself enabling typing notifications for PMs only in some organizations.
Ok, will start working on adding two separate ones as it seems natural for someone to be inclined to enable typing notifications for one and not for the other type.
Do we want to call them send_stream_typing_notifications and send_private_typing_notifications? That seems a little simpler.
Yes, those are better and simpler.

I'm thinking of adding a new view and URL for these. Something like rest_path("settings/privacy", PATCH=json_change_privacy_settings) and maybe move presence_enabled param from json_change_notify_settings to this new view as a follow-up since json_change_notify_settings seems specific to user receiving notifications. Does it make sense?
I think we don't want to create new /settings/foo endpoints; I feel like /settings/notifications and /settings/display as separate endpoints was a mistake.
I'll start a thread on #api design about this question: #api design > settings endpoints.

Added the settings for typing notifications and read receipts in #19200. They are not functional yet but we could make the typing indicators one functional.
About making them functional i.e, not sending typing notifications, do we want to just ignore the typing started/stopped requests and return json_success like we do with presence_enabled and not make any changes to the frontend code? That would help us avoid cluttering the frontend code specific to not sending these notifications but we can reduce the number of requests sent to server by not sending typing updates .

Should we change the icon for "Account and privacy" to a lock? Having two copies of the person icon in a row looks wrong:

image.png
I filed #19737 for this.
